alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 2:34PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Blaine and eastern Chouteau Counties through 315 PM MDT... At 233 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 18 miles southeast of Parker School, or 29 miles east of Big Sandy, moving southwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of western Blaine and eastern Chouteau Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
